intro: Caspareopsis monandra, commonly known as the white-flowered caspareopsis, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
